title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: He and his wife lived in Aberfeldy with their three sons, who attended the local school.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: On the journey back to Aberfeldy, Angus asked Michael if  he was happy at Bellcroft House.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: So that afternoon they drove the forty miles to the school near Aberfeldy, an establishment called Bellcroft House, where it turned out an appointment had been made to see the headmaster before they'd even gone on holiday.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: And if  it's at Aberfeldy would I have to stay there?

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: No, it's not far up the road, near Aberfeldy.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: Albert had been near Aberfeldy, and had toshoot and walk the whole way back, Lord Breadalbane himself beating, and 300 Highlanders outWe went out at five, with Lady Breadalbane andthe Duchess of Sutherland ; we saw part of LochTay, and drove along the banks of the Tay underfine trees, and saw Lord Breadalbane's Americanbuffaloes.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: They say he's awa 1 ower the hills to Aberfeldy, clean stark mad.'

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: Their pockets are lined with gold, they have bank accounts in Crieff and Aberfeldy bigger than mine, but they have a pauper's soul, every man among them.'

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: The Birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: They ne'er shall draw a wish fiae rae, Supremely blest wi' love and thee In the birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: The lioary cliffs are crown'd wi' flowers, White o'er the linns the bumie pours, And rising weets wi' misty showers The birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: The braes ascend like lofty wa's, The foaming sti-eam deep-roaring sa's, O'er-hung wi' fragrant spreading shaws, The birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: While o'er their heads the hazels hing, The little birdies blythtly sing, Or lightly slit on wanton wing In the birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The works of Robert Burns;
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Now simmer blinks on flowery braes, And o'er the crystal streamlet plays, Come let us spend the lightsome days, In the birks of Aberfeldy.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: — Come down Tay to Dunkeld — Glenlyon House — Lyon River — Druid's Temple — three circles of stones — the outer-most sunk — the second has thirteen stones remaining — the innermost has eight — two large detached ones like a gate, to the south-east — Say prayers in it — Pass Taybridge — Aberfeldy — described in rhyme — Castle Menzies — Inver — Dr. Stewart — sup.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: [An old strain, called "TheBirksof Abergeldie," was the forerunner of this sweet song : it was written, the poet says, standing under the Falls of Aberfeldy, near Moness, in Perthshire, during one of the tours whicn he made to the north, in the year 1787.]

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.

snippet: Tune — " The birks of Aberfeldy."

title: Story of Maurice Lestrange. Being an account of his travels and adventures in Scotland during the year 1765. [A tale.]
author: Omond, George William Thomson.
snippet: The man I sent was going to Aberfeldy;and I told him to go to Westermains on his way, andsee that no one but Mrs Arbuthnot got the letter.
